name: MSD
comment: Copyright The Athenz Authors Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. The Micro Segmentation Defense (MSD) API

StringTypeDef.name: SimpleName
StringTypeDef.comment: Copyright The Athenz Authors Licensed under the terms of the Apache version 2.0 license. See LICENSE file for terms. Common name types used by several API definitions A simple identifier, an element of compound name.

StringTypeDef.name: CompoundName
StringTypeDef.comment: A compound name. Most names in this API are compound names.

StringTypeDef.name: DomainName
StringTypeDef.comment: A domain name is the general qualifier prefix, as its uniqueness is managed.

StringTypeDef.name: EntityName
StringTypeDef.comment: An entity name is a short form of a resource name, including only the domain and entity.

StringTypeDef.name: EntityList
StringTypeDef.comment: An Entity list is comma separated compound Names

StringTypeDef.name: ServiceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A service name will generally be a unique subdomain.

StringTypeDef.name: ResourceName
StringTypeDef.comment: A resource name Note that the EntityName part is optional, that is, a domain name followed by a colon is valid resource name.

StringTypeDef.name: YEncoded
StringTypeDef.comment: YEncoded includes ybase64 chars, as well as = and %. This can represent a user cookie and URL-encoded values.

StringTypeDef.name: AuthorityName
StringTypeDef.comment: Used as the prefix in a signed assertion. This uniquely identifies a signing authority.

StringTypeDef.name: TransportPolicySubjectDomainName
StringTypeDef.comment: DomainName in TransportPolicySubject should allow * to indicate ANY

StringTypeDef.name: TransportPolicySubjectServiceName
StringTypeDef.comment: ServiceName in TransportPolicySubject should allow * to indicate ANY

EnumTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyEnforcementState
EnumTypeDef.comment: Types of transport policy enforcement states

EnumTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyValidationStatus
EnumTypeDef.comment: Validation Status of transport policy vs network policy

EnumTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyTrafficDirection
EnumTypeDef.comment: Types of transport policy traffic direction

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicySubject
StructTypeDef.comment: Subject for a transport policy

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: Name of the domain

fields.name: serviceName
fields.comment: Name of the service

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyCondition
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy condition. Used to specify additional restrictions for the subject of a transport policy

fields.name: enforcementState
fields.comment: State of transport policy enforcement ( ENFORCE / REPORT )

fields.name: instances
fields.comment: Acts as restrictions. If present, this transport policy should be restricted to only mentioned instances.

fields.name: scope
fields.comment: Scope of transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: PolicyPort
StructTypeDef.comment: generic policy port. Will be used by TransportPolicyPort and NetworkPolicyPort structs

fields.name: port
fields.comment: Start port of the port range. port and endPort will have same values for a single port definition.

fields.name: endPort
fields.comment: End port of the port range. port and endPort will have same values for a single port definition.

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyPort
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy port

fields.name: protocol
fields.comment: Protocol for this transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyMatch
StructTypeDef.comment: Selector for the subject of a transport policy

fields.name: athenzService
fields.comment: Subject where this transport policy applies

fields.name: conditions
fields.comment: List of additional requirements for restrictions. Requirements are ANDed.

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyPeer
StructTypeDef.comment: Source or destination for a transport policy

fields.name: athenzServices
fields.comment: List of transport policy subjects

fields.name: ports
fields.comment: List of network traffic port part of this transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyEntitySelector
StructTypeDef.comment: Entity to which a transport policy applies. Describes the subject and port(s) for a transport policy.

fields.name: match
fields.comment: Requirements for selecting the subject for this transport policy.

fields.name: ports
fields.comment: List of network traffic port of the subject eligible for the transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyIngressRule
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy ingress rule

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Assertion id associated with this transport policy

fields.name: lastModified
fields.comment: Last modification timestamp of this transport policy

fields.name: entitySelector
fields.comment: Entity to which this transport policy applies

fields.name: from
fields.comment: Source of network traffic

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyEgressRule
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy egress rule

fields.name: id
fields.comment: Assertion id associated with this transport policy

fields.name: lastModified
fields.comment: Last modification timestamp of this transport policy

fields.name: entitySelector
fields.comment: Entity to which this transport policy applies

fields.name: to
fields.comment: Destination of network traffic

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyRules
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy containing ingress and egress rules

fields.name: ingress
fields.comment: List of ingress rules

fields.name: egress
fields.comment: List of egress rules

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyValidationRequest
StructTypeDef.comment: Transport policy request object to be validated

fields.name: entitySelector
fields.comment: Describes the entity to which this transport policy applies

fields.name: peer
fields.comment: source or destination of the network traffic depending on direction

fields.name: id
fields.comment: If present, assertion id associated with this transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyValidationResponse
StructTypeDef.comment: Response object of transport policy rule validation

fields.name: updateTime
fields.comment: most recent update timestamp in the backend

fields.name: id
fields.comment: If present, assertion id associated with the transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: TransportPolicyValidationResponseList
StructTypeDef.comment: List of TransportPolicyValidationResponse

fields.name: responseList
fields.comment: list of transport policy validation response

EnumTypeDef.name: StaticWorkloadType
EnumTypeDef.comment: Enum representing defined types of static workloads.

StructTypeDef.name: DynamicWorkload
StructTypeDef.comment: workload type describing workload bootstrapped with an identity

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: serviceName
fields.comment: name of the service

fields.name: uuid
fields.comment: unique identifier for the workload, usually defined by provider

fields.name: ipAddresses
fields.comment: list of IP addresses associated with the workload, optional for getWorkloadsByIP API call

fields.name: hostname
fields.comment: hostname associated with the workload

fields.name: provider
fields.comment: infrastructure provider e.g. Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, openstack etc.

fields.name: updateTime
fields.comment: most recent update timestamp in the backend

fields.name: certExpiryTime
fields.comment: certificate expiry time (ex: getNotAfter)

fields.name: certIssueTime
fields.comment: certificate issue time (ex: getNotBefore)

StructTypeDef.name: Workload
StructTypeDef.comment: kept for backward compatibility sake. Will be eventually deprecated in favor of DynamicWorkload

StructTypeDef.name: StaticWorkload
StructTypeDef.comment: workload type describing workload indirectly associated with an identity ( without bootstrap )

fields.name: domainName
fields.comment: name of the domain

fields.name: serviceName
fields.comment: name of the service

fields.name: type
fields.comment: value representing one of the StaticWorkloadType enum

fields.name: ipAddresses
fields.comment: list of IP addresses associated with the workload, optional for getWorkloadsByIP API call

fields.name: name
fields.comment: name associated with the workload. In most cases will be a FQDN

fields.name: updateTime
fields.comment: most recent update timestamp in the backend

fields.name: ipChanged
fields.comment: boolean flag to signal a change in IP state

StructTypeDef.name: Workloads
StructTypeDef.comment: list of workloads

fields.name: workloadList
fields.comment: list of workloads

fields.name: dynamicWorkloadList
fields.comment: list of dynamic workloads

fields.name: staticWorkloadList
fields.comment: list of static workloads

StructTypeDef.name: StaticWorkloadService
StructTypeDef.comment: static workload service

fields.name: type
fields.comment: value representing one of the StaticWorkloadType enum

fields.name: serviceName
fields.comment: name of the service

fields.name: instance
fields.comment: service instance

StructTypeDef.name: StaticWorkloadServices
StructTypeDef.comment: list of services

EnumTypeDef.name: NetworkPolicyChangeEffect
EnumTypeDef.comment: IMPACT indicates that a change in network policy will interfere with workings of one or more transport policies NO_IMAPCT indicates that a change in network policy will not interfere with workings of any transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: IPBlock
StructTypeDef.comment: Struct representing ip blocks used by network policy in CIDR (Classless inter-domain routing) format

fields.name: cidr
fields.comment: cidr notation. can be used for ipv4 or ipv6

StructTypeDef.name: NetworkPolicyPort
StructTypeDef.comment: network policy port.

fields.name: protocol
fields.comment: protocol used by the network policy

StructTypeDef.name: NetworkPolicyPorts
StructTypeDef.comment: allows creating a unique tuple of source and destination ports

fields.name: sourcePorts
fields.comment: list of source ports

fields.name: destinationPorts
fields.comment: list of destination ports

StructTypeDef.name: NetworkPolicyChangeImpactRequest
StructTypeDef.comment: struct representing input details for evaluating network policies change impact on transport policies

fields.name: from
fields.comment: from ip address range list in cidr format

fields.name: to
fields.comment: to ip address range list in cidr format

fields.name: ports
fields.comment: list of ports. Facilitates multiple transports for the same source and destinations.

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: Name of the domain of the corresponding transport policy

fields.name: policy
fields.comment: Name of the Athenz policy corresponding to transport policy

fields.name: transportPolicyId
fields.comment: Unique id of the transport policy

StructTypeDef.name: NetworkPolicyChangeImpactResponse
StructTypeDef.comment: struct representing response of evaluating network policies change impact on transport policies

fields.name: effect
fields.comment: enum indicating effect of network policy change on one or more transport policies

fields.name: details
fields.comment: if the above enum value is IMPACT then this optional object contains more details about the impacted transport policies

StringTypeDef.name: rdl.Identifier
StringTypeDef.comment: All names need to be of this restricted string type

StringTypeDef.name: rdl.NamespacedIdentifier
StringTypeDef.comment: A Namespace is a dotted compound name, using reverse domain name order (i.e. "com.yahoo.auth")

StringTypeDef.name: rdl.ExtendedAnnotation
StringTypeDef.comment: ExtendedAnnotation - parsed and preserved, but has no defined meaning in RDL. Such annotations must begin with "x_", and may have an associated string literal value (the value will be "" if the annotation is just a flag).

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.TypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: TypeDef is the basic type definition.

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type this type is derived from. For base types, it is the same as the name

fields.name: name
fields.comment: The name of the type

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The comment for the type

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.AliasTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: AliasTypeDef is used for type definitions that add no additional attributes, and thus just create an alias

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.BytesTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Bytes allow the restriction by fixed size, or min/max size.

fields.name: size
fields.comment: Fixed size

fields.name: minSize
fields.comment: Min size

fields.name: maxSize
fields.comment: Max size

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.StringTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Strings allow the restriction by regular expression pattern or by an explicit set of values. An optional maximum size may be asserted

fields.name: pattern
fields.comment: A regular expression that must be matched. Mutually exclusive with values

fields.name: values
fields.comment: A set of allowable values

fields.name: minSize
fields.comment: Min size

fields.name: maxSize
fields.comment: Max size

UnionTypeDef.name: rdl.Number
UnionTypeDef.comment: A numeric is any of the primitive numeric types

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.NumberTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: A number type definition allows the restriction of numeric values.

fields.name: min
fields.comment: Min value

fields.name: max
fields.comment: Max value

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.ArrayTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Array types can be restricted by item type and size

fields.name: items
fields.comment: The type of the items, default to any type

fields.name: size
fields.comment: If present, indicate the fixed size.

fields.name: minSize
fields.comment: If present, indicate the min size

fields.name: maxSize
fields.comment: If present, indicate the max size

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.MapTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Map types can be restricted by key type, item type and size

fields.name: keys
fields.comment: The type of the keys, default to String.

fields.name: items
fields.comment: The type of the items, default to Any type

fields.name: size
fields.comment: If present, indicates the fixed size.

fields.name: minSize
fields.comment: If present, indicate the min size

fields.name: maxSize
fields.comment: If present, indicate the max size

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.StructFieldDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Each field in a struct_field_spec is defined by this type

fields.name: name
fields.comment: The name of the field

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type of the field

fields.name: optional
fields.comment: The field may be omitted even if specified

fields.name: default
fields.comment: If field is absent, what default value should be assumed.

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The comment for the field

fields.name: items
fields.comment: For map or array fields, the type of the items

fields.name: keys
fields.comment: For map type fields, the type of the keys

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.StructTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: A struct can restrict specific named fields to specific types. By default, any field not specified is allowed, and can be of any type. Specifying closed means only those fields explicitly

fields.name: fields
fields.comment: The fields in this struct. By default, open Structs can have any fields in addition to these

fields.name: closed
fields.comment: indicates that only the specified fields are acceptable. Default is open (any fields)

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.EnumElementDef
StructTypeDef.comment: EnumElementDef defines one of the elements of an Enum

fields.name: symbol
fields.comment: The identifier representing the value

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: the comment for the element

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.EnumTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Define an enumerated type. Each value of the type is represented by a symbolic identifier.

fields.name: elements
fields.comment: The enumeration of the possible elements

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.UnionTypeDef
StructTypeDef.comment: Define a type as one of any other specified type.

fields.name: variants
fields.comment: The type names of constituent types. Union types get expanded, this is a flat list

UnionTypeDef.name: rdl.Type
UnionTypeDef.comment: A Type can be specified by any of the above specialized Types, determined by the value of the the 'type' field

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.ResourceInput
StructTypeDef.comment: ResourceOutput defines input characteristics of a Resource

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the formal name of the input

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type of the input

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The optional comment

fields.name: pathParam
fields.comment: true of this input is a path parameter

fields.name: queryParam
fields.comment: if present, the name of the query param name

fields.name: header
fields.comment: If present, the name of the header the input is associated with

fields.name: pattern
fields.comment: If present, the pattern associated with the pathParam (i.e. wildcard path matches)

fields.name: default
fields.comment: If present, the default value for optional params

fields.name: optional
fields.comment: If present, indicates that the input is optional

fields.name: flag
fields.comment: If present, indicates the queryparam is of flag style (no value)

fields.name: context
fields.comment: If present, indicates the parameter comes form the implementation context

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.ResourceOutput
StructTypeDef.comment: ResourceOutput defines output characteristics of a Resource

fields.name: name
fields.comment: the formal name of the output

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type of the output

fields.name: header
fields.comment: the name of the header associated with this output

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The optional comment for the output

fields.name: optional
fields.comment: If present, indicates that the output is optional (the server decides)

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.ResourceAuth
StructTypeDef.comment: ResourceAuth defines authentication and authorization attributes of a resource. Presence of action, resource, or domain implies authentication; the authentication flag alone is required only when no authorization is done.

fields.name: authenticate
fields.comment: if present and true, then the requester must be authenticated

fields.name: action
fields.comment: the action to authorize access to. This forces authentication

fields.name: resource
fields.comment: the resource identity to authorize access to

fields.name: domain
fields.comment: if present, the alternate domain to check access to. This is rare.

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.ExceptionDef
StructTypeDef.comment: ExceptionDef describes the exception a symbolic response code maps to.

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type of the exception

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: the optional comment for the exception

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.Resource
StructTypeDef.comment: A Resource of a REST service

fields.name: type
fields.comment: The type of the resource

fields.name: method
fields.comment: The method for the action (typically GET, POST, etc for HTTP access)

fields.name: path
fields.comment: The resource path template

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The optional comment

fields.name: inputs
fields.comment: An Array named inputs

fields.name: outputs
fields.comment: An Array of named outputs

fields.name: auth
fields.comment: The optional authentication or authorization directive

fields.name: expected
fields.comment: The expected symbolic response code

fields.name: alternatives
fields.comment: The set of alternative but non-error response codes

fields.name: exceptions
fields.comment: A map of symbolic response code to Exception definitions

fields.name: async
fields.comment: A hint to server implementations that this resource would be better implemented with async I/O

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

fields.name: consumes
fields.comment: Optional hint for resource acceptable input types

fields.name: produces
fields.comment: Optional hint for resource output content types

fields.name: name
fields.comment: The optional name of the resource

StructTypeDef.name: rdl.Schema
StructTypeDef.comment: A Schema is a container for types and resources. It is self-contained (no external references). and is the output of the RDL parser.

fields.name: namespace
fields.comment: The namespace for the schema

fields.name: name
fields.comment: The name of the schema

fields.name: version
fields.comment: The version of the schema

fields.name: comment
fields.comment: The comment for the entire schema

fields.name: types
fields.comment: The types this schema defines.

fields.name: resources
fields.comment: The resources for a service this schema defines

fields.name: base
fields.comment: the base path for resources in the schema.

fields.name: annotations
fields.comment: additional annotations starting with "x_"

resources.comment: API endpoint to get the transport policy rules defined in Athenz

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any policies modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.comment: API to validate microsegmentation policies against network policies

inputs.name: transportPolicy
inputs.comment: Struct representing microsegmentation policy entered by the user

resources.name: validateTransportPolicy

resources.comment: API to get transport policy validation response for transport policies of a domain
resources.name: getTransportPolicyValidationStatus

resources.comment: API endpoint to get the transport policy rules defined in Athenz for a given domain

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any policies modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.name: getTransportPolicyRulesByDomain

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any workloads modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any workloads modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.comment: Api to perform a dynamic workload PUT operation for a domain and service Workload details are obtained from the service certificate
resources.name: putDynamicWorkload

resources.comment: Api to perform a dynamic workload DELETE operation for a domain, service, and instance

inputs.name: instanceId
inputs.comment: unique instance id within provider's namespace

resources.name: deleteDynamicWorkload

resources.comment: Api to perform a static workload PUT operation for a domain and service

inputs.name: staticWorkload
inputs.comment: Struct representing static workload entered by the user

resources.name: putStaticWorkload

resources.comment: Api to perform a static workload DELETE operation for a domain, service, and instance

inputs.name: name
inputs.comment: name associated with the workload. In most cases will be a FQDN

resources.name: deleteStaticWorkload

resources.comment: Api to retrieve static workload services by its type. type=StaticWorkloadType in String representation
resources.name: getStaticWorkloadServicesByType

inputs.name: matchingTag
inputs.comment: Retrieved from the previous request, this timestamp specifies to the server to return any workloads modified since this time

outputs.name: tag
outputs.comment: The current latest modification timestamp is returned in this header

resources.comment: API to evaluate network policies change impact on transport policies

inputs.name: detail
inputs.comment: Struct representing a network policy present in the system

resources.name: evaluateNetworkPolicyChange
